intro: Centropogon connatilobatus, commonly known as the narrow-lobed centropogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, clustered in inflorescences at the ends of the branches. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed soils.
